segments.text: Looking at the boy on the stool, I feel a sense of danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's stretching so high to reach that cookie jar, and the stool looks so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm scared he might fall and hurt himself at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little sister is right there, waiting for a cookie, unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice how the stool's legs are splayed out, ready to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's so focused on those cookies, just like any kid would be.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn't take a tumble; that floor looks hard and unforgiving.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but think about how kids always find a way to get into trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost within his reach, but it's not worth the risk.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would supervise them and keep them safe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is a disaster waiting to happen, and it's making me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR
